item.title: Epic Games Store Teases Free Game Ahead of Star Wars Day
item.description:
Summary

  • Epic Games Store has teased a Star Wars free game giveaway.
  • Fans speculate that a newer Star Wars game may be part of the promotion.
  • The game is being given away to celebrate Star Wars Day.

Epic Games Store has teased its upcoming free game in a way that gives an obvious nod to the Star Wars franchise. This intriguing update comes right ahead of Star Wars Day on May 4, which is an annual affair celebrated by Star Wars fans.

Since 2019, Epic Games Store has consistently given away games for free, usually on a weekly basis. Owing to that, patrons have amassed gigantic libraries filled with a wide variety of titles, ranging from indie hits such as Inside and Dread to some of the most popular AAA games such as GTA 5 and Death Stranding . With Star Wars Day fast approaching, there are whispers that another major release could make its way onto the PC game storefront as a freebie in the coming days. This speculation isn't something pulled out of thin air but is based on a recent tease shared by Epic Games Store on social media.

In a new post, Epic Games Store teased a free game in typical Star Wars fashion. The phrasing of its announcement took clear inspiration from the iconic Star Wars quote, "May the Force be with you," whereas the accompanying image depicted a star-studded space background with the text "Coming Soon." The digital service also shared that more about the same would be revealed in the near future. It's important to note that this cryptic tease comes just in time for Star Wars Day on Sunday, May 4. Due to this, many people have been speculating about a possible giveaway of a Star Wars game coming in the next few days. In the replies on social media, fans have chimed in with their predictions, which cover a broad spectrum of titles, from the classic 2003 game Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic to the newer Star Wars Outlaws from 2024.

Epic Games Store Hints at a Star Wars Game Giveaway Coming Soon

Judging by the signs, it looks highly likely that a Star Wars game could go free on Epic Games Store to mark the occasion for Star Wars Day. In case that happens, it won't be the first time a game from the sci-fi IP has been given away by the Epic Games Store since titles such as LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga and Star Wars Battlefront 2 have been up for grabs for free in the past. However, those games went free off-seasonâ€”in other words, they were given away far from the date of Star Wars Day. With the latest free game apparently coming close to the big day, there are chances that it could be a newer Star Wars title instead of an older pick from the franchise's games catalog.

Apart from Epic Games Store, Steam is also doing its own thing in preparation for Star Wars Day. It revolves around a themed promotion that will bring discounts on various Star Wars games available on Valve's platform, including a 50% price drop for Star Wars Outlaws . The sale is active at the time of writing and will run until May 5, 2025.

item.description: Many Nights a Whisper is available now on Steam and itch.io. Take a look at the official launch trailer here.

item.title: The Case for Resident Evil 9 to Have a Pursuer That's More Nemesis than Mr. X
item.description:
Summary

  • Capcom's future plans for Resident Evil remain undisclosed post the success of RE4 Remake.
  • Rumors suggest Resident Evil 9 will mark a major reinvention, possibly going open-world.
  • RE9 may want to have a Nemesis-type stalker in an open-world setting instead of one like Mr. X to remain effective.

Capcom has spent the last couple of years remaining tight-lipped about what it's planning next for Resident Evil . Not much has emerged about the future direction of the franchise since 2023's hugely successful RE4 Remake . Since then, fans have been anxiously awaiting to see what the upcoming Resident Evil entry, widely thought to be the ninth numbered installment, will turn out to be.

The official silence hasn't stopped multiple rumors and leaks from continuing to pop up, though. One of the most notable of these, according to a prominent industry figure (Dusk Golem), claims that Resident Evil 9 will be a "major reinvention." While it's always best to take such information with a grain of salt, there is reason to think this may be the case, particularly with the possibility of RE going open-world having long been suspected. And if this is accurate, Capcom may also need to rethink and iterate on how a pursuer-like enemy may work within it by taking more cues from RE3 's Nemesis instead of Mr. X from RE2 .

One encouraging update is Capcom recently releasing a short video commemorating RE4 Remake selling 10 million units that seemed to also briefly tease Resident Evil 9 .

If Resident Evil 9 Has a Pursuer in an Open-World, It Might Work Better More Like Nemesis Than Mr. X

Resident Evil 9's "Big Ambitions" Might Mean Its Stalker Also Needs to Evolve

Along with the open-world rumors that have proven a bit contentious among fans, even though it has yet to be confirmed or denied, various pieces of speculation from other sources have hinted at a few other potential details about Resident Evil 9 :

  • Legacy characters like Chris Redfield, Jill Valentine, and Leon Kennedy returning as leads
  • Set on a remote island centered on a moon-worshipping cult
  • Titled Resident Evil Apocalypse

Assuming that the open-world design is true to some degree, and that a pursuer will also follow, its design would need to account for this change to remain scary and effective. And Nemesis may be the best monster to look to in order to accomplish this.

Why Resident Evil 9 May Want to Channel Nemesis Instead of Mr. X for its Pursuer

While Mr. X may be the series' mascot for pursuers, if Resident Evil 9 features a classic stalker-type enemy alongside an open-world, having a figure like him wouldn't be as viable. His menace in RE2 , especially the remake, comes mainly from the fact that he blatantly marches into areas that were previously established as havens, violating the sense of safety they provided and forcing players to adjust. He is so effective precisely because RE2 's level design is intentionally claustrophobic, and his often unpredictable behavior in the cramped spaces is the main reason Mr. X's imposing presence causes so much terror.

Conversely, Resident Evil 3 Remake 's Nemesis is more scripted, and though this aspect was criticized for making the S.T.A.R.S. hunter feel comparatively less organic and spontaneous, this element was also true behind the scenes in the original. Nemesis appears mostly at predetermined points and set pieces, usually for a chase sequence culminating in a boss fight.

If Resident Evil 9 is moving into open-world territory, then players will ostensibly have more room to work with and could easily avoid a Mr. X-style pursuer, trivializing the sense of danger such a stalker presents, whose effectiveness is reliant upon smaller, linear levels. Nemesis' core behavior would likely lend itself better to an open-world RE . Capcom could iterate on it by having more predetermined encounters ala Nemesis, but spreading them out further and perhaps having more classic multi-stage battles with the latest stalker throughout. Making the latest pursuer more akin to Nemesis rather than Mr. X may thus be the best route to incorporating one in the next entry in order to keep the fear they provide strong.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Losing 7 Games Today
item.description:
Summary

  • Xbox Game Pass is losing 7 titles today, April 30.
  • The forthcoming departures include EA Sports NHL 23, Have a Nice Death, and Kona 2: Brume.
  • Xbox Game Pass is on course to lose 14 games in April 2025â€”the same amount that it added since the beginning of the month.

Xbox Game Pass is losing The Last Case of Benedict Fox and six other titles later today, April 30. Following these departures, 14 titles will have left the Xbox Game Pass library in April 2025.

Rare exceptions aside, Microsoft's subscription service usually follows a predictable schedule for removing games, with such rotations typically happening every 15 days. The most recent of these catalog updates happened on April 15, when Xbox Game Pass lost seven titles, including Homestead Arcana , Turbo Golf Racing , and Harold Halibut .

Another seven titles are now set to follow suit later today, April 30, when Xbox Game Pass will lose EA Sports NHL 23 , Have a Nice Death , and Kona 2: Brume . Sniper Elite 5 and The Last Case of Benedict Fox are also on the list of forthcoming departures, as are The Rewinder and Thirsty Suitors . Sniper Elite 5 had the longest run on the service among these titles, having first joined the Xbox Game Pass catalog in May 2022. Subscribers who enjoy the series' gameplay loop can attempt to fill the SE5 -shaped void with Sniper Elite: Resistance , which was added to Xbox Game Pass back in January 2025.

Xbox Game Pass Games Leaving Today

Game

Added

How Long To Beat

EA Sports NHL 23

Apr 2023

12â€“54 hours

Have a Nice Death

Apr 2024

9â€“66 hours

Kona 2: Brume

May 2024

8â€“11 hours

Sniper Elite 5

May 2022

10â€“42 hours

The Last Case of Benedict Fox

Apr 2023

11â€“15 hours

Thirsty Suitors

Nov 2023

7â€“14 hours

The Rewinder

Apr 2024

4â€“7 hours

While most of the titles from the April 30 batch of departures aren't overly long, beating any single one of them in a single day is still not really feasible for most. The Rewinder and Kona 2: Brume might be possible within that time frame, but only for the most dedicated achievement hunters. EA Sports NHL 23 is the only title from this roster not available through Xbox Game Pass Standard, as itâ€™s part of the EA Play catalog, which is exclusive to the PC and Ultimate tiers of the service.

Xbox Game Pass Added as Many Games as It Lost in April 2025

Following this upcoming library update, the total number of April 2025 Xbox Game Pass departures will rise to 14. In other words, Microsoft's subscription service will lose just as many games as it added over the course of the past month. Despite missing out on monthly net gains, Xbox Game Pass had a strong April, introducing multiple titles that are critically acclaimed, massively successful, or both. These include Blue Prince , Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , Grand Theft Auto 5 , and The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered .

Moving forward, Microsoft's subscription service has six confirmed games for May. Next month's batch starts with Anno 1800 and Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 , both of which are arriving on May 1. Dredge , Revenge of the Savage Planet , Doom: The Dark Ages , and To A T are also coming to Xbox Game Pass in May 2025.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: Best Spells For Each Patch 8 Subclass
item.description:
The release of Patch 8 in Baldur's Gate 3 has marked a final send-off for the game by the devs, adding a number of fixes and new features, including twelve new subclasses. Naturally, players have been jumping right into playing these new options, particularly the various new casters and half-casters available in the game.

In Baldur's Gate 3 , finding a build that works for your Tav and each companion is important, as every little thing from stat points, Feat selection, gear, and Spell choice can make all the difference between a successful build and a failure. If you're looking for some good Spells to consider using with one of the new Subclasses, the best Spells for each Baldur's Gate 3 Patch 8 Subclass have been outlined in the guide below.

The Best Spells For Each Baldur's Gate 3 Patch 8 Subclass, Explained

Baldur's Gate 3 Patch 8 marked the final sendoff for the game, complete with twelve new Subclasses for players to experience. These twelve Subclasses are listed below :

  • Path of Giants Barbarian
  • College of Glamour Bard
  • Death Domain Cleric
  • Circle of the Stars Druid
  • Arcane Archer Fighter
  • Way of the Drunken Master Monk
  • Oath of the Crown Paladin
  • Swarmkeeper Ranger
  • Swashbuckler Rogue
  • Shadow Magic Sorcerer
  • Hexblade Warlock
  • Bladesinger Wizard

Of those twelve Subclasses, seven of them are Spellcasters or half-casters. These eight caster classes are narrowed down to Glamour Bard, Death Cleric, Stars Druid, Swarmkeeper Ranger, Shadow Magic Sorcerer, Hexblade Warlock, and the Bladesinger Wizard. However, Patch 8 also introduced a few new Spells and Cantrips, so knowing the best Spells and Cantrips for each of these Classes will come in handy when it comes to setting up your builds.

Flesh to Stone

60ft

CON

Atrophy a foe, Restraining them until they temporarily turn to stone:

  • Affected entity cannot move as its body begins to petrify over the course of 3 turns.
  • Attack rolls against it have Advantage, while the entity's Attack Rolls and Dexterity Saving throws have Disadvantage.

The target will Petrify if it does not succeed its Saving Throw within 3 turns:

  • Turned to stone. Can't move or take Actions, Bonus Actions, or Reactions.
